intro: Lutzia oocarpa, commonly known as the purple mangosteen, is a tropical plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its large, thick-skinned fruits that contain segmented, juicy arils. The plant typically grows as a small tree or shrub, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its leaves are elliptical,革质 (leathery), and have a smooth surface. The flowers are small, white, and clustered in inflorescences, contributing to its ornamental value.
